command: $target='198.51.100.77'; $seq=@(7005,53,16000,8088); foreach($u in $seq){ Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -UdpPort $u -InformationLevel Quiet | Out-Null; Start-Sleep -Milliseconds 300 }; Test-NetConnection -ComputerName $target -Port 4444 -InformationLevel Detailed
explanation: Performs UDP-based port knocking (including DNS-like 53) to blend with normal traffic, then attempts TCP 4444. Detection: monitor for unusual UDP probes to closed ports and mixed UDP/TCP sequences from a single source within tight timing windows; IDS/IPS rules for sequential UDP probes.
rationale_steps: Define target host and UDP knock sequence with service-mimicking ports.
Send UDP probes as signaling knocks.
Attempt TCP connection to the signaled backdoor port.
Defenders: watch for sequential UDP hits to closed ports and immediate TCP follow-up; analyze firewall drop logs and flow data.
